intro: Aspidosperma lagoense, commonly known as the Lagoense Vatairea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its woody structure and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or yellowish in color. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds. Aspidosperma lagoense is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
